name: London
hint: Capital of the United Kingdom, home to Big Ben and Buckingham Palace

name: Paris
hint: Capital of France, known as the City of Light

name: Berlin
hint: Capital of Germany, once divided by a famous wall

name: Rome
hint: Capital of Italy, the Eternal City with ancient ruins

name: Madrid
hint: Capital of Spain, located in the center of the Iberian Peninsula

name: Amsterdam
hint: Capital of the Netherlands, famous for its canals and tulips

name: Vienna
hint: Capital of Austria, historic center of the Habsburg Empire

name: Prague
hint: Capital of the Czech Republic, known as the City of a Hundred Spires

name: Stockholm
hint: Capital of Sweden, spread across 14 islands

name: Athens
hint: Capital of Greece, birthplace of democracy and the Acropolis

name: Lisbon
hint: Capital of Portugal, built on seven hills along the Tagus River

name: Warsaw
hint: Capital of Poland, rebuilt after extensive WWII destruction

name: Moscow
hint: Capital of Russia, home to the Kremlin and Red Square

name: Copenhagen
hint: Capital of Denmark, known for Tivoli Gardens and the Little Mermaid statue

name: Dublin
hint: Capital of Ireland, famous for its literary history and Georgian architecture

name: Oslo
hint: Capital of Norway, situated at the head of a fjord

name: Helsinki
hint: Capital of Finland, a Baltic Sea port known for design and architecture

name: Budapest
hint: Capital of Hungary, formed by uniting Buda and Pest on opposite banks of the Danube

name: Bucharest
hint: Capital of Romania, nicknamed Little Paris for its elegant Belle Epoque buildings

name: Brussels
hint: Capital of Belgium and de facto capital of the European Union
